message:
Hi Everyone. Our first Tuesday Code Club session will be the 15th Jan @ 5pm

We will be looking at the new Scratch 3 editor
Happy New Year Everyone. I will let you all know when the Code Club sessions can resume at St Marys. In the meantime, take a look at Scratch 3. It should be replacing Scratch 2 shortly 😊😊😊

data.description: Our largest turnout to date. Thank you so much for attending and showing such enthusiasm. A massive thanks to parents and Library staff for their support this past year. Looking forward to seeing you all at St Marys in the new year. Look out for our starting date. A very Merry Christmas to you all - Stewart, Yvonne, John & Brian. :-)

message: Our largest turnout to date. Thank you so much for attending and showing such enthusiasm. A massive thanks to parents and Library staff for their support this past year. data.description:
Tuesday evening we all had a go at BBC Micro Bit programming. Everybody got the hang of it real quick and we had some brilliant creations.
We will be using the BBC Micro Bit more next year, so get your thinking caps on.
Adding numbers on the Micro Bit and then shaking it to display the answer!
data.title: Tuesday Codeclub

data.description: Making the Micro Bit smile and Frown at the press of a button.
data.title: Tuesday Codeclub
Tuesday Codeclub

message:
Tuesday evening we all had a go at BBC Micro Bit programming. Everybody got the hang of it real quick and we had some brilliant creations.
We will be using the BBC Micro Bit more next year, so get your thinking caps on.
We modified our VEX Robot to have flashing lights and a siren. Well done guys. Next time we are going to investigate the colour sensor and precise turning using the Gyro.

data.description: Yesterday we were coding with the VEX IQ Robot, the BBC Micro Bit, Raspberry PI and Scratch. Thank you to all who dropped in, including some new volunteers to help with our sessions.
Using MODKit to program the VEX IQ Robot.

data.description:
Thank you to all that attended todays Code Club. 😊 

We will be back in November and then will take a break while the Library moves to it’s new home in January. 

A big thank you to Yvonne Smith and staff for hosting us.

message:
Thank you to all that attended todays Code Club. 😊 

We will be back in November and then will take a break while the Library moves to it’s new home in January. 

A big thank you to Yvonne Smith and staff for hosting us.

Saturday Code Club is on tomorrow 1pm - 3pm
in Lichfield Library.

Looking forward to seeing you if you have an interest in computer programming.

We will be showing Raspberry Pi, Micro Bit, Scratch and the VEX IQ Robot.
Tuesday night Code Club sessions resume tonight.

data.description: Thank you to Tim Wilson, Midlands Code Club Co-ordinator for visiting our club last Tuesday evening. 😊

message: Thank you to Tim Wilson, Midlands Code Club Co-ordinator for visiting our club last Tuesday evening. 😊

data.description: On Sunday Jonathon and I took Code Club to the Cosford Air Show. A great day was had by all.
data.title: Code Club at RAF Cosford

message: On Sunday Jonathon and I took Code Club to the Cosford Air Show. A great day was had by all.

Hello everyone. We are starting a new session on Tuesday June 5th. Please contact Yvonne Smith at Lichfield Library to register your interest. Age limit is 9-13. We will be following the Code Club Curriculum, using Scratch initially. These sessions are best suited to beginners.

Hello Everybody, I am sorry we are unable to host our Saturday Code Club session this month. I think we will re-asses after the Library move now. Monday sessions are unaffected and next session is Monday 14th May. Don’t hesitate to contact us if you have any questions. Happy Coding, Stewart & Johnathon 😊
Aiming to be in Lichfield Library on Saturday 12th May. 😊
Here is one of our coders games in action. Here we are using loops and conditional code to give the illusion of moving traffic.

data.title: Photos from Curborough Community Centre Code Club's post

message: Some of our activities tonight included Scratch games and an introduction to Python programming.

data.description: Well Done everyone. Some great coding and animations over the past few months. 😊

message: Well Done everyone. Some great coding and animations over the past few months. 😊
Sorry Folks Code Club is cancelled tonight. See you all next week.

data.description: A great turn out tonight for our Monday Night Code Club sessions. Lots of great ideas going on with Scratch tonight. Home made games and animations. Nice to see everyone using lots of different code constructs such as loops and broadcast events in their code. Well Done everyone. I think we will be dishing out some certificates next week :-)

message: A great turn out tonight for our Monday Night Code Club sessions. Lots of great ideas going on with Scratch tonight. Home made games and animations. Nice to see everyone using lots of different code constructs such as loops and broadcast events in their code. Well Done everyone. I think we will be dishing out some certificates next week :-)

data.description: Coding an analog clock in Scratch. We decided that testing the hour hand first was not the best idea. Our young programmers decided to speed the second hand up to count milli-seconds. A great way to see the minute and hour hand changing!
Here we are using a £2 accelerometer connected to a Raspberry PI to control the aircraft on the screen. This simple game was written using the PyGame library.

Here we are using ModKit to program a VEX IQ Robot. The programming is based on Scratch, so it was very familiar to our young coders. One of our programmers discovered the joys of recursion, when the robot decided to wrap itself around the programming cable. This proved a great insight into event driven coding and a great test of our reaction speed to reach for the STOP button. :-)

data.title: Photos from Curborough Community Centre Code Club's post

message: Saturday Code Club saw us programming the VEX IQ Robot and Johnathon helping with some complex Scratch programming.
